benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/tags - Add tags to account

covered: Valid payloads (single & multiple tag creation) produce 201 and return Tag objects (TC01, TC02, TC04, TC05).
Required and optional headers handled: X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced; X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment accepted (TC03, TC11).
Request body schema and validation: empty array, non-array body, malformed UUIDs, non-existent tag definitions, and unexpected extra fields are tested (TC07, TC08, TC09, TC10, TC17, TC23).
Path parameter handling: missing accountId, invalid accountId format, and non-existent account are covered (TC12, TC13, TC14).
Authorization negative case: missing/invalid authentication token returns 401 (TC15).
Dependency/system failure handling: external/tag service unavailable simulated (503) (TC16).
Concurrency and duplicate handling: duplicate IDs within a request and concurrent requests are exercised (TC19, TC21, TC05).
Boundary/performance tests: large-payload boundary (100 items) and a basic response-time assertion (2s) are present (TC18, TC20).
Security/sanitization: header injection is tested to check sanitization/escaping (TC22).
Regression and compatibility: special-character regression and API version backward-compatibility tests included (TC23, TC24).
Query parameters/pagination: tests ensure limit/offset/sort query parameters are ignored on this POST (TC06).
gaps: Permission granularity (403 Forbidden): no test for a valid token with insufficient permissions (role/permission-based denial).
Rate limiting/throttling behavior (429): no tests that exercise throttling/rate-limit responses under sustained load.
Internal server error (500) and DB failure/rollback semantics: only 503 is simulated; no explicit 500 or transactional rollback (partial-failure) tests exist.
Idempotency / duplicate submission semantics across repeated identical POSTs (server behaviour on repeated calls) is not explicitly tested/defined.
Partial-success/atomicity when payload contains a mix of valid and invalid tag IDs is not covered (should the whole request fail or partially succeed?).
Content-Type / Accept handling (missing or wrong Content-Type leading to 415 or 400) is not tested.
Response header validation (Content-Type: application/json, Location, rate-limit headers, caching) is missing.
Stress/scale beyond the 100-item boundary (e.g., very large payloads, thousands of IDs) and resource limits are not covered.
Input boundary/fuzzing cases (nulls, empty strings, numbers, nested objects in array) are absent.
Injection/sanitization in request body elements (UUID values) is not tested—only header injection is present.
Detailed verification of Tag object fields/metadata (tagDefinitionId, accountId, createdBy, createdReason/comment, timestamps) is not asserted in depth.
Behavior when tags already exist and client retries across separate requests (server dedup rules / response codes) is not fully specified or tested.
recommendations: Add a 403 Forbidden test: call the endpoint with a valid auth token that lacks tag-creation permission and assert 403 + explanatory message.
Add rate-limiting tests: issue many requests in a short window to assert 429 or configured throttling behaviour and recovery semantics.
Simulate internal server (500) and DB failures: assert 500 responses and verify transactional rollback (no partial tag persistence).

Add atomicity tests for mixed payloads: submit arrays with a combination of valid, non-existent and malformed IDs and assert the documented behaviour (reject-all or fail-partial) and verify DB state accordingly.
Add Content-Type/Accept tests: missing/incorrect Content-Type (e.g., text/plain) should return 415/400 as per API contract.
Add idempotency/retry tests: repeat identical POSTs and assert no duplicate tag records are created and that response codes conform to the API spec.
Extend large-payload/stress testing beyond 100 items (e.g., 1k+) and include load tests to discover performance limits and memory/timeouts.
Add response-header assertions: verify Content-Type: application/json, charset, and any Location, CORS or rate-limit headers that should be present or absent.
Add input-fuzzing tests for body elements (nulls, numbers, empty strings, nested objects) and body-based injection attempts to assert robust validation and sanitization.
Assert Tag object contents in responses and persistence: verify tagDefinitionId, accountId, createdBy matches header, createdReason/comment persisted when provided, and timestamps are present/valid.
